normalised: E V Charging Gets a Desi Boost!

unnormalised: Guess what, auto enthusiasts? The EV scene is heating up faster than a tawa making dosas! Forget range anxiety – charging is becoming a breeze, especially here in India.
normalised: Guess what, auto enthusiasts? The E V scene is heating up faster than a tawa making dosas! Forget range anxiety – charging is becoming a breeze, especially here in India.

unnormalised: Ola Electric just announced they're rolling out a *massive* expansion of their Hypercharger network. They're aiming for 10,000 chargers across the country by next year. Think Bangalore, Mumbai, even smaller towns in Kerala!
normalised: Ola Electric just announced they are rolling out a massive expansion of their Hypercharger network. They are aiming for ten thousand chargers across the country by next year. Think Bangalore, Mumbai, even smaller towns in Kerala!

unnormalised: And Tata Power is getting in on the action too! They're teaming up with various housing societies and shopping malls, to provide charging solutions right where you park. Imagine plugging in while you grab a plate of piping hot biryani during Eid!
normalised: And Tata Power is getting in on the action too! They are teaming up with various housing societies and shopping malls, to provide charging solutions right where you park. Imagine plugging in while you grab a plate of piping hot biryani during Eid!

unnormalised: Speaking of Kerala, the Kochi Metro is piloting a cool solar-powered EV charging station. Imagine travelling by metro, then charging up your electric scooter powered by the sun – talk about eco-friendly!
normalised: Speaking of Kerala, the Kochi Metro is piloting a cool solar-powered E V charging station. Imagine travelling by metro, then charging up your electric scooter powered by the sun – talk about eco-friendly!

unnormalised: Meanwhile, IIT Delhi is researching faster charging tech that could reduce charging times drastically. Early reports indicate that soon you could fully charge your EV in under 30 minutes, so you can quickly dash off to enjoy the Onam Sadhya.
normalised: Meanwhile, I I T Delhi is researching faster charging tech that could reduce charging times drastically. Early reports indicate that soon you could fully charge your E V in under thirty minutes, so you can quickly dash off to enjoy the Onam Sadhya.

unnormalised: Some smaller companies are even offering portable EV chargers, like a power bank for your car. Things are definitely getting interesting, folks!
normalised: Some smaller companies are even offering portable E V chargers, like a power bank for your car. Things are definitely getting interesting, folks!
